perturbation.original_text: 1.6 "Control" means, with respect to the relationship between or among two or more Persons, shall mean the possession, directly or indirectly, or as trustee or executor, of the power to direct or cause the direction of the affairs or management of a Person, whether through the ownership of voting securities, as trustee or executor, by contract or otherwise, including, without limitation, the ownership, directly or indirectly, of securities having the power to elect a majority of the board of directors or similar body governing the affairs of such Person余 provided that neither PlanetCAD nor shall be deemed to be controlled by any other Person or under common control with any Person that is not one of their respective subsidiaries.
perturbation.changed_text: 1.6 "Influence" means, with respect to the relationship between or among two or more Persons, shall mean the ability to suggest changes in the affairs or management of a Person, whether through the ownership of voting securities, by contract or otherwise, including, without limitation, the ownership, directly or indirectly, of securities having the power to suggest a member of the board of directors or similar body governing the affairs of such Person余 provided that neither PlanetCAD nor shall be deemed to be influenced by any other Person or under common influence with any Person that is not one of their respective subsidiaries.
perturbation.explanation: The term 'Control' has a specific legal definition concerning the power to direct management, while 'Influence' is far more ambiguous. This change weakens the contractual definition, making it difficult to enforce provisions tied to control, potentially leading to disputes over liability and responsibility.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General contract law principles regarding definiteness and enforceability of terms.

perturbation.original_text:
8.1 Mutual Representations. Each party represents and warrants to the other party as follows:
                  (a) The performance of this Agreement does not infringe or
conflict with any Intellectual Property right of any third party, and (ii) no
confidential, proprietary or trade secret information of either party or their
personnel that will be used in performing this Agreement has been
misappropriated from any third party余 and
perturbation.changed_text:
8.1 Mutual Understandings. Each party understands to the other party as follows:
                  (a) The performance of this Agreement does not infringe or
conflict with any Intellectual Property right of any third party, and (ii) no
confidential information of either party or their
personnel that will be used in performing this Agreement has been obtained from any third party余 and
perturbation.explanation: The term 'Representations and Warranties' are changed into 'Mutual Understandings'. Also, 'proprietary or trade secret information' changed to 'confidential information'. This change dilutes the legal weight of these assurances. 'Representations and warranties' are legally binding statements of fact; 'understandings' are not. Also, 'proprietary or trade secret information' have distinct legal protections compared to general 'confidential information'. This affects liability for IP infringement or misappropriation.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract law principles regarding the meaning and effect of representations and warranties.

perturbation.original_text:
11.16 Expenses. Except as expressly provided for in this
Agreement, each party shall bear its own expenses incurred in connection with this Agreement, including without limitation travel and living expenses incurred by that party's employees.
perturbation.changed_text:
11.16 Financial Burdens. Except as expressly provided for in this
Agreement, each party may decide whether or not bear its own expenses incurred in connection with this Agreement, including without limitation travel and living expenses incurred by that party's employees.
perturbation.explanation: Replacing 'expenses' with 'financial burdens' and 'shall' to 'may decide whether or not bear' introduces ambiguity and weakens the enforceability of this provision. 'Expenses' is a clear, objective term. 'Financial burdens' is more subjective. Also, 'shall' indicates a mandatory obligation, but 'may decide whether or not bear' makes it optional. This could lead to disputes about who is responsible for costs associated with the agreement.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract law principles regarding the definiteness and enforceability of obligations.
